good.description: Comfortable temperature range for all activities with minimal thermal stress
recommendations: Perfect for outdoor activities like hiking, cycling, and sports
Light, breathable clothing is sufficient - cotton or linen fabrics work well
No need for heating or cooling adjustments in buildings
Ideal for extended outdoor exposure and physical activities
Great conditions for outdoor dining, picnics, and social gatherings
Safe for all age groups including infants and elderly

hot.description: Warm temperatures require attention to prevent overheating
hot.healthImpact: Minor heat stress possible, monitor for discomfort
recommendations: Stay hydrated - drink 8-10 glasses of water throughout the day
Wear light-colored, loose-fitting, breathable clothing (cotton, linen)
Take regular breaks in shaded or air-conditioned areas every 30-60 minutes
Monitor for signs of overheating (excessive sweating, dizziness, fatigue)
Reduce intensity of strenuous outdoor activities
Avoid peak heat hours (10 AM - 4 PM) for intensive activities
Use sunscreen and wear hats to prevent additional heat from sun exposure

cold.description: Cool temperatures require preparation to maintain warmth
cold.healthImpact: Minor cold stress possible, monitor for discomfort
recommendations: Wear layered clothing for easy temperature adjustment throughout the day
Dress warmly with insulating layers - wool, fleece, or synthetic materials
Take regular breaks in heated areas every 30-60 minutes
Monitor for signs of getting too cold (shivering, numbness in extremities)
Protect extremities with gloves, warm socks, and insulated footwear
Keep moving to maintain body heat during outdoor activities
Have warm beverages available to help maintain core temperature

hot.description: Extreme heat poses serious health risks including heat stroke
hot.healthImpact: High risk of heat-related illness, heat exhaustion, and heat stroke
recommendations: Avoid prolonged outdoor exposure - limit to 15-30 minutes maximum
Seek air-conditioned environments immediately when feeling uncomfortable
Wear cooling vests or wet towels if outdoor exposure is necessary
Monitor for heat exhaustion symptoms (nausea, weakness, rapid heartbeat, confusion)
Have emergency cooling supplies ready (ice packs, cold towels, electrolyte drinks)
Never leave anyone (especially children, elderly, or pets) in vehicles
Stay near emergency services and have medical contacts readily available
Increase fluid intake significantly - sports drinks may be beneficial

activities.precautions: emergency heat illness prevention and treatment supplies required

cold.description: Extreme cold poses serious health risks including hypothermia and frostbite
cold.healthImpact: High risk of hypothermia, frostbite, and cold-related injuries
recommendations: Avoid prolonged outdoor exposure - limit to 15-30 minutes maximum
Seek heated environments immediately when feeling uncomfortable
Wear multiple insulating layers and waterproof outer shell
Monitor for hypothermia symptoms (confusion, slurred speech, drowsiness, shivering stops)
Have emergency warming supplies ready (blankets, hot beverages, heat packs)
Never leave anyone (especially children, elderly, or pets) in unheated vehicles
Stay near emergency services and have medical contacts readily available
Protect all exposed skin - cover face, hands, and feet completely

activities.precautions: emergency hypothermia prevention and treatment supplies required

good.description: Air quality is safe for everyone including sensitive groups
recommendations: Safe for all outdoor activities and exercise including high-intensity workouts
Windows can be opened for fresh air circulation
No restrictions for sensitive groups (asthma, heart disease, elderly, children)
Perfect conditions for outdoor sports and recreational activities
Ideal for outdoor dining and social gatherings
Great time for outdoor photography and nature activities

moderate.description: Air quality may affect sensitive individuals but is acceptable for most people
moderate.healthImpact: Possible respiratory irritation for sensitive individuals
recommendations: Limit outdoor activities if you have respiratory conditions (asthma, COPD, heart disease)
Consider wearing a mask (N95 or equivalent) if you're sensitive to air pollution
Keep windows closed and use air purifiers indoors, especially in bedrooms
Monitor local air quality alerts and forecasts throughout the day
Reduce outdoor exercise intensity and duration for sensitive individuals
Children and elderly should limit prolonged outdoor activities

dangerous.description: Air quality poses health risks to everyone, especially sensitive groups
dangerous.healthImpact: High risk of respiratory and cardiovascular effects
recommendations: Stay indoors with windows and doors closed - use air conditioning if available
Wear N95 or higher-grade masks when going outside is absolutely necessary
Avoid all outdoor exercise and strenuous activities
Use air purifiers and avoid activities that create indoor pollution (cooking, smoking)
Seek medical attention if experiencing breathing difficulties, chest pain, or unusual fatigue
Cancel outdoor events and activities until air quality improves
Stock up on essential supplies to minimize outdoor trips

good.description: Light winds provide pleasant conditions with no safety concerns
good.healthImpact: No wind-related health or safety risks
recommendations: Perfect conditions for all outdoor activities including water sports
Safe for all types of outdoor equipment, decorations, and temporary structures
No restrictions for outdoor events, markets, or gatherings
Ideal for activities like picnics, outdoor dining, and children's play
Great for drone flying, kite flying, and other wind-sensitive activities
Perfect for outdoor photography and filming

moderate.description: Moderate winds require some precautions for safety and comfort
moderate.healthImpact: Possible debris hazards, increased difficulty with balance
recommendations: Secure lightweight outdoor items (umbrellas, chairs, decorations, signage)
Be cautious with large objects that could catch wind (tarps, awnings, banners)
Consider wind direction when planning outdoor activities and seating arrangements
Monitor weather updates for potential wind increases throughout the day
Use windbreaks or sheltered areas for outdoor dining and activities
Exercise caution when opening car doors in parking areas

dangerous.description: Strong winds pose significant safety hazards and property damage risks
dangerous.healthImpact: High risk of injury from flying debris and falling objects
recommendations: Bring all outdoor furniture, decorations, and loose items indoors immediately
Avoid walking under trees, power lines, or near tall structures that could fall
Stay away from power lines and report any downed lines immediately
Postpone all outdoor activities until winds subside to safe levels
Be extremely cautious when driving, especially high-profile vehicles (trucks, RVs)
Prepare for potential power outages and have emergency supplies ready
Check on neighbors and secure any community areas or shared spaces

good.description: Light gusts provide refreshing conditions without safety concerns
recommendations: No special precautions needed for wind gusts
Safe for all outdoor activities and events without restrictions
Normal outdoor setup and equipment can be used safely
Perfect conditions for outdoor recreation and sports
Ideal for outdoor dining and social gatherings
Great for activities that benefit from light air movement

moderate.description: Strong gusts require increased awareness and precautions
moderate.healthImpact: Possible sudden loss of balance, flying debris risk
recommendations: Secure items that could be blown away suddenly (hats, papers, lightweight furniture)
Be prepared for sudden changes in wind intensity - stay alert
Hold onto hats, umbrellas, and loose clothing when outdoors
Stay alert when walking near trees, signs, or structures that could be affected
Consider postponing activities involving balance (cycling, skateboarding)
Use caution when opening doors, especially car doors in parking areas

dangerous.description: Severe gusts are extremely dangerous and can cause serious injury
dangerous.healthImpact: High risk of injury from sudden impacts and flying debris
recommendations: Avoid going outdoors unless absolutely necessary for emergency situations
Stay away from windows and glass doors that could shatter from debris
Expect power outages and have emergency supplies ready (flashlights, batteries, food)
Do not drive unless it's a life-threatening emergency
Report downed power lines, damaged trees, or dangerous debris immediately
Prepare for potential structural damage and have emergency contacts ready
Stay indoors and away from large windows until gusts subside

good.description: Minimal precipitation with negligible impact on activities
good.healthImpact: No precipitation-related health or safety concerns
recommendations: Light rain jacket or umbrella may be sufficient for comfort
Roads and walkways remain safe for normal travel and activities
Outdoor activities can continue with minimal or no adjustments
Perfect weather for indoor activities with occasional outdoor excursions
Ideal for photography - dramatic skies without safety concerns
Great for gardening and outdoor work

moderate.description: Moderate rain requires preparation and affects outdoor activities
recommendations: Carry waterproof clothing, umbrellas, and rain gear
Allow extra time for travel due to wet conditions and reduced visibility
Be cautious of slippery surfaces and reduced traction on walkways and roads
Consider moving outdoor activities indoors or to covered areas
Use appropriate footwear with good traction for wet surfaces
Check drainage around your property to prevent water accumulation

dangerous.description: Heavy precipitation creates hazardous conditions and flood risks
dangerous.healthImpact: High risk of accidents, flooding, and getting stranded
recommendations: Avoid non-essential travel and outdoor activities completely
Watch for flooding in low-lying areas, near waterways, and in underpasses
Never drive through flooded roads or walkways - turn around, don't drown
Prepare for potential power outages and communication disruptions
Have emergency supplies ready including food, water, flashlights, and batteries
Monitor local emergency alerts and evacuation notices
Stay informed about road closures and emergency shelter locations

good.description: Excellent visibility for all activities and transportation
recommendations: Safe for all types of travel and transportation without restrictions
Perfect conditions for sightseeing, photography, and outdoor recreation
No restrictions for outdoor activities or sports
Ideal for driving, cycling, walking, and all forms of transportation
Great for outdoor events and activities requiring good visibility
Perfect for navigation and wayfinding

moderate.description: Reduced visibility requires extra caution, especially for travel
moderate.healthImpact: Increased accident risk due to reduced visibility
recommendations: Use headlights when driving even during daytime hours
Reduce speed and increase following distance while driving
Be extra cautious at intersections, crosswalks, and merge points
Consider postponing non-essential travel if visibility continues to decrease
Use well-lit routes and stay on familiar paths when walking
Keep emergency supplies in vehicles in case of unexpected delays

activities.precautions: use lights, reduce speed, increase following distance

dangerous.description: Poor visibility creates dangerous conditions for all activities
dangerous.healthImpact: High risk of accidents and getting lost or stranded
recommendations: Avoid driving unless absolutely necessary for emergency situations
Use fog lights, hazard lights, and follow road markers when driving
Stay on main roads and avoid unfamiliar or secondary routes
Walk close to buildings and use well-lit, familiar paths only
Have emergency contacts and location sharing enabled on devices
Carry flashlights, emergency supplies, and communication devices
Consider postponing all non-essential activities until visibility improves

good.description: Minimal UV exposure risk for extended outdoor activities
good.healthImpact: No UV-related health concerns for most people
recommendations: No special sun protection required for most people during normal activities
Safe for extended outdoor activities without UV concerns
Sunglasses recommended for comfort and eye protection but not essential
Perfect conditions for outdoor recreation without time restrictions
Great for outdoor sports, hiking, and all-day outdoor events
Ideal for children's outdoor play and activities

moderate.description: UV protection becomes important to prevent skin damage
moderate.healthImpact: Risk of sunburn and long-term skin damage without protection
recommendations: Apply broad-spectrum sunscreen (SPF 30+) to all exposed skin 30 minutes before going outside
Wear protective clothing, wide-brimmed hats, and UV-blocking sunglasses
Seek shade during peak sun hours (10 AM - 4 PM) when UV is strongest
Reapply sunscreen every 2 hours or after swimming, sweating, or toweling off
Consider UV-protective clothing for extended outdoor activities
Monitor skin for changes and protect children with extra care

dangerous.description: Extreme UV levels pose serious health risks including severe burns
dangerous.healthImpact: High risk of severe sunburn, skin damage, and heat-related illness
recommendations: Minimize sun exposure, especially during midday hours (10 AM - 4 PM)
Use SPF 50+ broad-spectrum sunscreen and reapply every hour
Wear long-sleeved shirts, long pants, wide-brimmed hats, and wrap-around sunglasses
Stay in shade or indoors during peak UV hours whenever possible
Protect eyes with UV-blocking sunglasses and consider a UV umbrella
Monitor for signs of heat exhaustion and sunburn throughout the day
Keep emergency supplies for treating sunburn and heat-related illness

activities.precautions: maximum UV protection and heat illness prevention

good.description: Optimal humidity levels for comfort, health, and performance
good.healthImpact: No humidity-related health or comfort concerns
recommendations: Comfortable conditions for all activities without humidity concerns
No special precautions needed for humidity-related issues
Perfect for indoor and outdoor activities, exercise, and work
Ideal conditions for respiratory health and overall comfort
Great for outdoor sports and physical activities
Perfect for sleeping and indoor comfort

moderate.description: Elevated humidity affects comfort and body's cooling efficiency
moderate.healthImpact: Reduced cooling efficiency, increased heat stress risk
recommendations: Stay hydrated as sweating becomes less effective for cooling
Use fans, air conditioning, or dehumidifiers to improve comfort
Wear lightweight, breathable, moisture-wicking clothing
Take more frequent breaks during physical activities
Monitor for signs of heat exhaustion (heavy sweating, weakness, dizziness)
Consider timing outdoor activities for cooler parts of the day

dangerous.description: Extremely high humidity severely impairs body's cooling ability
dangerous.healthImpact: High risk of heat exhaustion, heat stroke, and dehydration
recommendations: Limit outdoor physical activities to prevent dangerous overheating
Stay in air-conditioned environments when possible
Increase fluid intake significantly to prevent dehydration
Monitor for heat-related illness symptoms (nausea, dizziness, confusion, rapid heartbeat)
Use dehumidifiers indoors to improve air quality and comfort
Wear minimal, loose-fitting, light-colored clothing
Have emergency cooling supplies ready (ice packs, cold towels, electrolyte drinks)

activities.precautions: heat illness prevention and emergency cooling supplies
